TITLE: Basic Earthfile Structure in Dockerfile Syntax
DESCRIPTION: Shows the fundamental structure of an Earthfile, which includes base recipes, target declarations, and command definitions. This structure forms the foundation of Earthly build files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/earthfile/earthfile.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```
<base-recipe>
...

<target-name>:
    <recipe>
    ...

<target-name>:
    <recipe>
    ...

<command-name>:
    <recipe>
    ...
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Proper Artifact References Between Earthly Targets
DESCRIPTION: Shows the correct pattern for passing artifacts between Earthly targets using artifact references. This approach properly expresses dependencies between targets and ensures they run in the correct order.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/guides/best-practices.md#2025-04-21_snippet_21

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
# Good
all:
    BUILD +build
dep:
    ...
    SAVE ARTIFACT my-artifact.jar
build:
    ...
    COPY +dep/my-artifact.jar ./
    ...
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Dockerfile vs Earthfile Conversion Example
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to convert a multi-stage Dockerfile to an Earthfile format. Shows the differences in approach between Dockerfile's AS syntax and Earthly's target-based architecture.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/earthfile/earthfile.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```
# Dockerfile

FROM alpine:3.18 AS build
# ... instructions for build

FROM build as another
# ... further instructions inheriting build

FROM busybox as yet-another
COPY --from=build ./a-file ./
```

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```
# Earthfile

build:
    FROM alpine:3.18
    # ... instructions for build
    SAVE ARTIFACT ./a-file

another:
    FROM +build
    # ... further instructions inheriting build

yet-another:
    FROM busybox
    COPY +build/a-file ./
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Properly Copying External Files Using Artifact References in Earthly
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the correct way to copy a file from another directory by referencing an exported artifact from a target in that directory's Earthfile.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/guides/best-practices.md#2025-04-21_snippet_45

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
# ./dir2/Earthfile
# Good
COPY ../dir1+file/some-file.txt ./
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Multi-Stage Build for Optimal Production Images
DESCRIPTION: The recommended approach using separate images for build and production, where only the necessary artifacts are copied to a minimal production image, resulting in smaller image sizes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/guides/best-practices.md#2025-04-21_snippet_39

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
# Good
FROM go:1.16
RUN apk add ... # development dependencies
build:
    COPY ...
    RUN go mod download
    COPY ...
    RUN go build ... -o ./build/app
    SAVE ARTIFACT ./build/app
image:
    FROM alpine:3.18 # start afresh
    RUN apk add ... # production dependencies only
    COPY +build/app /usr/bin/app
    ENTRYPOINT ["/usr/bin/app"]
    SAVE IMAGE my-production-image:latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using WITH DOCKER for Integration Tests in Earthly
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to use Earthly's WITH DOCKER command with docker-compose for integration testing. This pattern demonstrates running tests in a Docker-in-Docker environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/guides/best-practices.md#2025-04-21_snippet_53

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
integration-test:
    FROM earthly/dind:alpine-3.19-docker-25.0.5-r0
    COPY docker-compose.yml ./
    WITH DOCKER --compose docker-compose.yml
        RUN ...
    END
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Cache Mounts with RUN in Earthly
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the --mount option with type=cache to persist cache data between builds. This example sets up a Go build cache that persists even when dependencies change, improving build speeds.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/earthfile/earthfile.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
ENV GOCACHE=/go-cache
RUN --mount=type=cache,target=/go-cache go build main.go
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Java Project Earthfile Configuration
DESCRIPTION: This Earthfile configures the build process for a Java project using Gradle. It defines targets for dependencies, building, creating a Docker image, and running the application with PostgreSQL using Docker Compose.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/basics/part-6-using-docker-with-earthly.md#2025-04-21_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
VERSION 0.8
FROM openjdk:8-jdk-alpine
RUN apk add --update --no-cache gradle
WORKDIR /java-example

deps:
    COPY build.gradle ./
    RUN gradle build

build:
    FROM +deps
    COPY src src
    RUN gradle build
    RUN gradle install
    SAVE ARTIFACT build/install/java-example/bin AS LOCAL build/bin
    SAVE ARTIFACT build/install/java-example/lib AS LOCAL build/lib

docker:
    COPY +build/bin bin
    COPY +build/lib lib
    ARG tag='latest'
    ENTRYPOINT ["/java-example/bin/java-example"]
    SAVE IMAGE java-example:$tag

with-postgresql:
    FROM earthly/dind:alpine-3.19-docker-25.0.5-r0
    COPY ./docker-compose.yml .
    RUN apk update
    RUN apk add postgresql-client
    WITH DOCKER --compose docker-compose.yml --load app:latest=+docker
        RUN while ! pg_isready --host=localhost --port=5432; do sleep 1; done ;\
            docker run --network=default_java/part6_default app
    END
```

TITLE: Accessing Secrets in RUN Commands Using Environment Variables in Earthfiles
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to access a secret stored under 'passwd' and expose it as an environment variable 'mypassword' in a RUN command. Secrets allow sensitive data to be used during builds without storing them in the Earthfile.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/guides/secrets.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```
FROM alpine:latest
hush:
    RUN --secret mypassword=passwd echo "my password is $mypassword"
```

TITLE: Using Earthly Target Form Command
DESCRIPTION: Basic syntax for executing an Earthly build using the target form. This form builds a specified target and its dependencies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/earthly-command/earthly-command.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
earthly [options...] <target-ref> [build-args...]
```

TITLE: Basic Earthfile Structure for Go Project
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the basic structure of an Earthfile for a Go project, including version specification, base image selection, and working directory setup.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/basics/part-1-a-simple-earthfile.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
VERSION 0.8
FROM golang:1.15-alpine3.13
WORKDIR /go-workdir

build:
    COPY main.go .
    RUN go build -o output/example main.go
    SAVE ARTIFACT output/example AS LOCAL local-output/go-example

docker:
    COPY +build/example .
    ENTRYPOINT ["/go-workdir/example"]
    SAVE IMAGE go-example:latest
```

TITLE: Efficient Directory Copying Using COPY --dir
DESCRIPTION: The recommended approach to copy multiple directories in a single command using the Earthly-specific --dir flag, which maintains directory structure and reduces cache layers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/guides/best-practices.md#2025-04-21_snippet_37

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
# Good
COPY --dir dir-1 dir-2 dir-3 ./
```

TITLE: Building and Copying with Platform Specification in Earthly
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to build a target with platform specification and build arguments, then copy files from it in Earthly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/earthfile/earthfile.md#2025-04-21_snippet_32

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
my-target:
    BUILD --platform=linux/amd64 +some-target --FOO=bar
    COPY --platform=linux/amd64 (+some-target/some-file.txt --FOO=bar) ./
```

TITLE: Go Integration Test
DESCRIPTION: Integration test for Go application testing Redis connectivity and data persistence.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/basics/part-6-using-docker-with-earthly.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: go
CODE:
```
package main

import (
	"context"
	"testing"

	"github.com/go-redis/redis/v8"
	"github.com/stretchr/testify/require"
)

func TestIntegration(t *testing.T) {
	ctx := context.Background()
	rdb := redis.NewClient(&redis.Options{
		Addr:     "redis:6379",
		Password: "", // no password set
		DB:       0,  // use default DB
	})

	err := rdb.Set(ctx, "howCoolIsEarthly", howCoolIsEarthly, 0).Err()
	if err != nil {
		panic(err)
	}

	resultFromDB, err := rdb.Get(ctx, "howCoolIsEarthly").Result()
	if err != nil {
		panic(err)
	}
	require.Equal(t, howCoolIsEarthly, resultFromDB)
}
```

TITLE: Initial Earthfile Setup for Go Project
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the initial setup of an Earthfile for a Go project, including version, base image, and working directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/basics/part-1-a-simple-earthfile.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
VERSION 0.8
FROM golang:1.15-alpine3.13
WORKDIR /go-workdir
```

TITLE: Defining a Function in Earthly
DESCRIPTION: Example of defining a reusable function called MY_COPY that can copy files with optional recursive flag. Functions must start with the FUNCTION keyword and use ALL_UPPERCASE_SNAKE_CASE naming.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/guides/functions.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
MY_COPY:
    FUNCTION
    ARG src
    ARG dest=./
    ARG recursive=false
    RUN cp $(if $recursive =  "true"; then printf -- -r; fi) "$src" "$dest"
```

TITLE: Proper Image Loading with WITH DOCKER --load
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the recommended pattern for passing Docker images between Earthly targets using WITH DOCKER --load. This properly expresses dependencies and loads the image into the Docker daemon for use in tests.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/guides/best-practices.md#2025-04-21_snippet_24

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
# Good
all:
    BUILD +test
dep-img:
    ...
    SAVE IMAGE my-co/my-image:latest
test:
    WITH DOCKER --load=+dep-img
        RUN docker run my-co/my-image:latest
    END
```

TITLE: Improved Layer Caching Example in Earthly
DESCRIPTION: Better caching approach that specifically copies only required files, reducing unnecessary cache invalidation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/caching/caching-in-earthfiles.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```
# Better
COPY go.mod go.sum ./*.go ./
RUN go mod download
RUN go build ...
```

TITLE: Basic Earthfile Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Main Earthfile configuration demonstrating basic build, lint and Docker targets for a Go application
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: earthly
CODE:
```
VERSION 0.8
FROM golang:1.15-alpine3.13
RUN apk --update --no-cache add git
WORKDIR /go-example

all:
  BUILD +lint
  BUILD +docker

build:
  COPY main.go .
  RUN go build -o build/go-example main.go
  SAVE ARTIFACT build/go-example AS LOCAL build/go-example

lint:
  RUN go get golang.org/x/lint/golint
  COPY main.go .
  RUN golint -set_exit_status ./...

docker:
  COPY +build/go-example .
  ENTRYPOINT ["/go-example/go-example"]
  SAVE IMAGE go-example:latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using SSH Authentication with RUN in Earthly
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the --ssh flag with RUN to access the host's SSH authentication client for tasks like secure Git operations. The example configures SSH known hosts and sets up Git to use SSH instead of HTTPS for GitHub repositories.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/earthfile/earthfile.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
RUN mkdir -p ~/.ssh && \
    echo 'github.com ssh-rsa ' >> ~/.ssh/known_hosts && \
    echo 'gitlab.com ssh-rsa ' >> ~/.ssh/known_hosts
RUN --ssh git config --global url."git@github.com:".insteadOf "https://github.com/" && \
    go mod download
```

TITLE: Specifying VERSION Command Syntax in Earthfiles
DESCRIPTION: The VERSION command is used in Earthfiles to specify which version of Earthly the file depends on. This command was introduced in version 0.5 and became required as of version 0.7. It allows for optional flags followed by the version number.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/earthfile/features.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
VERSION [<flags>...] <version-number>
```

TITLE: Creating Multi-platform Docker Images with Separate Targets
DESCRIPTION: Earthfile example showing how to create a multi-platform Docker image by building separate targets for different architectures and merging them during export.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/guides/multi-platform.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```
build-all-platforms:
    BUILD +build-amd64
    BUILD +build-arm-v7

build-amd64:
    FROM --platform=linux/amd64 alpine:3.18
    ...
    SAVE IMAGE --push org/myimage:latest

build-arm-v7:
    FROM --platform=linux/arm/v7 alpine:3.18
    ...
    SAVE IMAGE --push org/myimage:latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Recommended GIT CLONE Usage in Earthly
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the recommended way to use GIT CLONE in Earthly, which provides better caching and hash awareness compared to RUN git clone.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/guides/best-practices.md#2025-04-21_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
GIT CLONE git@github.com/my-co/my-proj my-proj
WORKDIR my-proj
RUN ls
```

TITLE: Build Target for Go Application in Earthfile
DESCRIPTION: Defines a build target in the Earthfile that compiles a Go application and saves the output as an artifact.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/basics/part-1-a-simple-earthfile.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
build:
    COPY main.go .
    RUN go build -o output/example main.go
    SAVE ARTIFACT output/example
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Earthfile with Artifact Saving
DESCRIPTION: Earthfile example showing how to copy artifacts between targets without saving locally. The build target creates an executable and the docker target uses it to create a Docker image.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/basics/part-2-outputs.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
build:
    COPY main.go .
    RUN go build -o output/example main.go
    SAVE ARTIFACT output/example

docker:
    #  COPY command copies files from the +build target
    COPY +build/example .
    ENTRYPOINT ["/go-workdir/example"]
    SAVE IMAGE go-example:latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Conditional Base Image Selection in Earthly
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to choose different base images based on platform architecture using Earthly's IF statement. This pattern allows selecting different images for different platforms, such as using the official golang image for ARM64 and a company-specific image for other architectures.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/guides/best-practices.md#2025-04-21_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
FROM alpine:3.18
ARG TARGETPLATFORM
IF [ "$TARGETPLATFORM" = "linux/arm64" ]
    FROM golang:1.16
ELSE
    FROM my-company/golang:1.16
END
```

TITLE: Proper Deployment Using RUN --push in Earthly
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the correct approach for pushing build artifacts to external services using RUN --push. This ensures the command only executes in push mode, is never cached, and runs after all other build steps have completed successfully.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/guides/best-practices.md#2025-04-21_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
# Good
RUN --push --secret GITHUB_TOKEN github-release upload ...
```

TITLE: Installing Earthly directly in Linux CI environment
DESCRIPTION: Shell commands to download a specific version of Earthly for Linux, make it executable, and bootstrap the installation. This method is recommended for dedicated computers or auto-provisioned build environments.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/ci-integration/overview.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
wget https://github.com/earthly/earthly/releases/download/v0.8.13/earthly-linux-amd64 -O /usr/local/bin/earthly && \
chmod +x /usr/local/bin/earthly && \
/usr/local/bin/earthly bootstrap
```

TITLE: Creating an End-to-End Test Script in Bash
DESCRIPTION: A bash script that runs the application in a Docker container and verifies the output matches the expected result using assert_eq. It demonstrates a simple smoke test approach for a containerized application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/guides/integration.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
source "./assert.sh"
set -v
results=$(docker run --network=host earthly/examples:integration)
expected="The first 5 countries alphabetically are: Afghanistan, Albania, Algeria, American Samoa, Andorra"

assert_eq "$expected" "$results"n
```

TITLE: Python Earthfile with Build and Docker Targets (Dockerfile)
DESCRIPTION: An Earthfile for a Python project demonstrating build and docker targets, including referencing a subdirectory target and handling dependencies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/basics/part-5-importing.md#2025-04-21_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
VERSION 0.8
FROM python:3
WORKDIR /code

build:
    FROM ./services/service-one+deps
    COPY src src
    SAVE ARTIFACT src /src

docker:
    COPY +deps/wheels wheels
    COPY +build/src src
    COPY requirements.txt ./
    ARG tag='latest'
    RUN pip install --no-index --find-links=wheels -r requirements.txt
    ENTRYPOINT ["python3", "./src/hello.py"]
    SAVE IMAGE python-example:$tag
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: JavaScript Earthfile Example
DESCRIPTION: Complete Earthfile example for a JavaScript project, demonstrating various Earthly commands and ARG usage.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/basics/part-4-args.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
VERSION 0.8
FROM node:13.10.1-alpine3.11
WORKDIR /js-example

deps:
    COPY package.json ./
    COPY package-lock.json ./
    RUN npm install
    # Output these back in case npm install changes them.
    SAVE ARTIFACT package.json AS LOCAL ./package.json
    SAVE ARTIFACT package-lock.json AS LOCAL ./package-lock.json

build:
    FROM +deps
    COPY src src
    RUN mkdir -p ./dist && cp ./src/index.html ./dist/
    RUN npx webpack
    SAVE ARTIFACT dist /dist AS LOCAL dist

docker:
    FROM +deps
    ARG tag='latest'
    COPY +build/dist ./dist
    EXPOSE 8080
    ENTRYPOINT ["/js-example/node_modules/http-server/bin/http-server", "./dist"]
    SAVE IMAGE js-example:$tag
```

TITLE: RUN Command with Secrets Example
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use secrets in RUN commands with both explicit env var naming and shorthand syntax. Shows how secrets can be passed from the command line to secure operations like GitHub releases.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/earthfile/earthfile.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```
release:
    RUN --push --secret GITHUB_TOKEN=GH_TOKEN github-release upload
release-short:
    RUN --push --secret GITHUB_TOKEN github-release upload
```

TITLE: Using Earthly Artifact Form Command
DESCRIPTION: Syntax for executing an Earthly build to output a specific artifact. This builds the referenced artifact and its dependencies, but only outputs the specified artifact.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/earthly-command/earthly-command.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash

```
earthly [options...] --artifact|-a <target-ref>/<artifact-path> [<dest-path>] [build-args...]

TITLE: Basic Earthly Configuration Structure in YAML
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the basic structure of the Earthly configuration file in YAML format, showing how to organize global and git-specific settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/earthly-config/earthly-config.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

CODE:
```
global:
  cache_size_mb: <cache_size_mb>
git:
    global:
        url_instead_of: <url_instead_of>
    <site>:
        auth: https|ssh
        user: <username>
        password: <password>
    <site2>:
        ...

TITLE: Using Dockerfile and Build Context from Separate Artifact References
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to split a Dockerfile and build context across separate artifact references. The example creates a build context with data, a separate Dockerfile, and then combines them using the FROM DOCKERFILE command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/earthfile/earthfile.md#2025-04-21_snippet_36

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
FROM alpine

mybuildcontext:
    WORKDIR /mydata
    RUN echo mydata > myfile
    SAVE ARTIFACT /mydata

mydockerfile:
    RUN echo "
FROM busybox
COPY myfile .
RUN cat myfile" > Dockerfile
    SAVE ARTIFACT Dockerfile

docker:
    FROM DOCKERFILE -f +mydockerfile/Dockerfile +mybuildcontext/mydata/*
    SAVE IMAGE testimg:latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using required ARGs in Earthfile
DESCRIPTION: Example of using a required ARG in an Earthfile target and providing it in a BUILD command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/earthfile/earthfile.md#2025-04-21_snippet_23

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
target-required:
    # user must supply build arg for target
    ARG --required NAME

build-linux:
    # or explicitly supply in build command
    BUILD +target-required --NAME=john
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining a Smoke Test in Earthly Configuration
DESCRIPTION: An Earthly target configuration that sets up a test environment with Docker Compose, waiting for PostgreSQL to be ready before running the smoke test. It demonstrates how to orchestrate dependencies for integration testing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/guides/integration.md#2025-04-21_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```
smoke-test:
    FROM +project-files
    COPY docker-compose.yml ./ 
    COPY src/smoketest ./ 
    WITH DOCKER --compose docker-compose.yml --load=+docker
        RUN while ! pg_isready --host=localhost --port=5432 --dbname=iso3166 --username=postgres; do sleep 1; done ;\
            ./smoketest.sh
    END
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Improved Docker-in-Docker Setup Using Earthly Functions
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows an improved approach to Docker-in-Docker by installing Docker engine before copying files that might change frequently, improving caching efficiency.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/guides/best-practices.md#2025-04-21_snippet_52

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
# Better
integration-test:
    FROM some-other-image:latest
    DO github.com/earthly/lib+INSTALL_DIND
    COPY docker-compose.yml ./
    WITH DOCKER --compose docker-compose.yml
        RUN ...
    END
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Combining All Test Targets in Earthly
DESCRIPTION: An Earthly target that combines unit tests, integration tests, and smoke tests into a single command, creating a comprehensive testing pipeline that can be run with one command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/guides/integration.md#2025-04-21_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```
all:
  BUILD +build
  BUILD +unit-test
  BUILD +integration-test
  BUILD +smoke-test
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Saving Artifacts from WITH DOCKER Operations in Earthly
DESCRIPTION: Pattern for exporting artifacts generated within a WITH DOCKER block. This technique demonstrates how to capture screenshots, logs, and Docker state information from containers for later use in the build.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/guides/best-practices.md#2025-04-21_snippet_54

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
WITH DOCKER ...
    RUN docker run -v ./screenshots:/screenshots ... && \
        docker logs ... >./full-logs.txt && \
        docker inspect ... >./some-docker-state.json
END
SAVE ARTIFACT ./screenshots
SAVE ARTIFACT ./full-logs.txt
SAVE ARTIFACT ./some-docker-state.json
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Docker Target for Go Application in Earthfile
DESCRIPTION: Creates a Docker target in the Earthfile that builds a Docker image from the compiled Go application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/basics/part-1-a-simple-earthfile.md#2025-04-21_snippet_5

CODE:
```

  RUN apt-get update -qq
  RUN apt-get install --no-install-recommends -qq autoconf autotools-dev libtool-bin clang cmake bsdmainutils

  DO rust+INIT --keep_fingerprints=true

TITLE: Advanced IF Condition with Semantic Version Comparison
DESCRIPTION: Shows a more complex conditional example using Python to perform semantic version comparison. The code installs the semver package, creates a custom script for version comparison, and then uses it in an IF/ELSE condition.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/earthfile/earthfile.md#2025-04-21_snippet_39

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
VERSION 0.8

test:
  FROM python:3
  RUN pip3 install semver

  # The following python script requires two arguments (v1 and v2)
  # and will return an exit code of 0 when v1 is semantically greater than v2
  # or an exit code of 1 in all other cases.
  RUN echo "#!/usr/bin/env python3
import sys
import semver
v1 = sys.argv[1]
v2 = sys.argv[2]
if semver.compare(v1, v2) > 0:
  sys.exit(0)
sys.exit(1)
  " > ./semver-gt && chmod +x semver-gt

  # Define two different versions
  ARG A="0.3.2"
  ARG B="0.10.1"

  # and compare them
  IF ./semver-gt "$A" "$B"
    RUN echo "A ($A) is semantically greater than B ($B)"
  ELSE
    RUN echo "A ($A) is NOT semantically greater than B ($B)"
  END
```

TITLE: Pattern Matching Syntax for .earthlyignore
DESCRIPTION: Defines the syntax rules for specifying file exclusion patterns in .earthlyignore files. Patterns use filepath.Match syntax from Go, supporting wildcards, character classes, and escape sequences.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/earthfile/earthlyignore.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
pattern:
	{ term }
term:
	'*'         matches any sequence of non-Separator characters
	'?'         matches any single non-Separator character
	'[' [ '^' ] { character-range } ']'
	            character class (must be non-empty)
	c           matches character c (c != '*', '?', '\\', '[')
	'\\' c      matches character c

character-range:
	c           matches character c (c != '\\', '-', ']')
	'\\' c      matches character c
	lo '-' hi   matches character c for lo <= c <= hi
```

TITLE: Handling cgroups v2 in Bash Script
DESCRIPTION: This bash script snippet shows how to handle cgroups v2 in a custom entrypoint script. It detects cgroups v2 and moves the process to a separate cgroup to prevent resource busy errors.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/ci-integration/build-an-earthly-ci-image.md#2025-04-21_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
if [ -f "/sys/fs/cgroup/cgroup.controllers" ]; then
    echo "detected cgroups v2; moving pid $$ to subgroup"

    # move the process under a new cgroup to prevent buildkitd/entrypoint.sh
    # from getting a "sh: write error: Resource busy" error while enabling controllers
    # via echo +pids > /sys/fs/cgroup/cgroup.subtree_control
    mkdir -p /sys/fs/cgroup/my-entrypoint
    echo "$$" > /sys/fs/cgroup/my-entrypoint/cgroup.procs
fi
```

TITLE: Earthly Build Process Flow Diagram
DESCRIPTION: Detailed sequence diagram showing the complete flow of an Earthly target build from CLI initiation through Earthfile parsing, command interpretation, and final execution. Includes interaction between major components like Builder, BuildKitClient, Earthfile2LLB, and Docker pull operations. Notable complexities include recursive target handling and WAIT/END logic implications.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs-internals/build-steps.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: mermaid
CODE:
```
sequenceDiagram
    BuildAction ->> Builder : BuildTarget
    Builder ->> BuildKitClient : Build (and passes BuildFunc callback)
    BuildKitClient ->> BuildFunc : Callback
    BuildFunc ->> Earthfile2LLB : Earthfile2LLB

    Earthfile2LLB ->> Resolver : Resolve
    Resolver ->> ast : Parse
    ast -->> Resolver : Parsed Earthfile
    Resolver -->> Earthfile2LLB : buildcontext

    Earthfile2LLB ->> Interpreter : Run

    loop
        Interpreter ->> Converter : EarthfileCommand
        Converter -->> Interpreter : Results
    end

    Interpreter -->> Earthfile2LLB : Results

    Earthfile2LLB ->> Converter : FinalizeStates
    Converter -->> Earthfile2LLB : LLB State

    Earthfile2LLB ->> BuildFunc : mts results

    loop
        BuildFunc ->> gatewaycrafter : AddMeta(referenceKey, LLB)
        gatewaycrafter -->> BuildFunc : Results
    end

    BuildFunc -->> BuildKitClient : Results

    BuildKitClient ->> pullping : OutputPullCallback

    pullping ->> docker : docker pull
    docker -->> pullping : results

    pullping -->> BuildKitClient : results
    BuildKitClient -->> Builder : results
    Builder -->> BuildAction : results
```

TITLE: Configuring Earthfile for Next.js Build and Deployment to Netlify
DESCRIPTION: This Earthfile defines three targets: deps, build, and deploy. It sets up the environment, installs dependencies, builds the Next.js site using Netlify CLI, and deploys to Netlify. It uses secrets for authentication and site identification.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/examples/next-js-netlify/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```
VERSION 0.6
FROM --platform=linux/amd64 node:latest
WORKDIR /app

deps:
    # Install the Netlify CLI (global)
    RUN npm install netlify-cli -g
    # Copy package.json for installing required packages
    COPY package.json ./
    # Install the Netlify CLI (local) and Netlify Next.js plugin and required packages
    RUN npm install netlify-cli --save-dev
    RUN npm install @netlify/plugin-nextjs --save-dev
    RUN npm install
    # Copy netlify.toml - required for building and deploying to Netlify
    COPY netlify.toml ./

build:
    FROM +deps
    # Copy files and directories required for building
    COPY next-env.d.ts styles.module.css tsconfig.json ./
    COPY --dir pages ./
    # Build site using NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN and NETLIFY_SITE_ID secrets
    RUN --secret NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN --secret NETLIFY_SITE_ID netlify build --context production
    SAVE ARTIFACT ./node_modules node_modules/ AS LOCAL ./
    SAVE ARTIFACT ./.next .next/ AS LOCAL ./
    SAVE ARTIFACT ./.netlify .netlify/ AS LOCAL ./

deploy:
    FROM +deps
    # Copy artifacts required for deploying to Netlify
    COPY +build/node_modules/ +build/.next/ +build/.netlify/ ./
    # Deploy site
    RUN --push --secret NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN --secret NETLIFY_SITE_ID netlify deploy --prod
```

TITLE: Insecure Multi-Layer Secret Handling in Earthly
DESCRIPTION: Shows a dangerous pattern where secret files are created in one layer but removed in another. This exposes secrets in the intermediate layer, potentially leaking them to the build cache or published images.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/guides/best-practices.md#2025-04-21_snippet_19

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
# Bad: removal takes place in a separate layer, which means that the secrets will be leaked to the cache
RUN --secret AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID --secret AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY echo "[default]\naws_access_key_id=$AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID\naws_secret_access_key=$AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY" > /root/.aws/credentials
RUN aws ec2 describe-images
RUN rm /root/.aws/credentials
```

TITLE: Implementing Main Application in Scala
DESCRIPTION: Main application code that retrieves and displays the first 5 countries alphabetically from a PostgreSQL database using doobie for database access.

Object Main extends App {
  val dal = new DataAccessLayer()
  val dv = new DataVersion()

  if(dv.version() > 1)
  {
    implicit val cs = IO.contextShift(ExecutionContext.global)
    val xa = Transactor.fromDriverManager[IO](
      "org.postgresql.Driver", 
      "jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/iso3166", 
      "postgres",
      "postgres"
    )

    val countries = dal.countries(5)
                       .transact(xa).unsafeRunSync
                       .toList.map(_.name).mkString(", ")

    println(s"The first 5 countries alphabetically are: $countries")
  }
}
```

SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/examples/cpp/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: C++
CODE:
```
#include "fib.h"

int fib(int n)
{
	if( n <= 0 ) {
		return 0;
	}
	if( n == 1 ) {
		return 1;
	}
	return fib(n-1) + fib(n-2);
}
```

TITLE: Building Earthly using multi-stage Dockerfile
DESCRIPTION: This Dockerfile uses a multi-stage build to create a minimal Earthly image. It starts with a Go build environment, compiles the Earthly binary, and then creates a final image with only the necessary components.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/util/fileutil/testdata/globdirs/file.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
FROM golang:1.20-bullseye AS build-env
WORKDIR /earthly
COPY go.mod go.sum ./
RUN go mod download
COPY . ./
ARG VERSION=dev
RUN --mount=type=cache,target=/root/.cache/go-build \
    go build -tags noembed -ldflags "-X main.Version=$VERSION -X main.GitSha=$EARTHLY_GIT_HASH" -o earthly ./cmd/earthly

FROM debian:bullseye-slim
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends \
    ca-certificates \
    git \
    openssh-client \
    && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*
WORKDIR /usr/local/bin
COPY --from=build-env /earthly/earthly ./
ENTRYPOINT ["earthly"]
```

TITLE: Single-Image Approach for Build and Production (Not Recommended)
DESCRIPTION: A non-recommended approach that uses the same image for both building and production, resulting in bloated production images that contain unnecessary development dependencies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/guides/best-practices.md#2025-04-21_snippet_38

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
# Avoid: production image is bloated
FROM go:1.16
RUN apk add ... # development + production dependencies
build:
    COPY ...
    RUN go mod download
    COPY ...
    RUN go build ... -o /usr/bin/app
    ENTRYPOINT ["/usr/bin/app"]
    SAVE IMAGE my-production-image:latest
```

TITLE: Pulling Images from GCP Artifact Registry in Earthly
DESCRIPTION: An Earthfile target that demonstrates how to pull and run an image from GCP Artifact Registry using the WITH DOCKER directive in Earthly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/guides/registries/gcp-artifact-registry.md#2025-04-21_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: dockerfile
CODE:
```
FROM earthly/dind:alpine-main

run:
    WITH DOCKER --pull <region>-docker.pkg.dev/<project>/hello-earthly/hello-earthly:with-love
        RUN docker run <region>-docker.pkg.dev/<project>/hello-earthly/hello-earthly:with-love
    END
```

TITLE: Incorrect File Copying From Target to LOCALLY Target
DESCRIPTION: This shows an incorrect approach to copying files from a regular target to a LOCALLY target using AS LOCAL, which fails because outputs are written at the end of the build, causing timing issues.
SOURCE: https://github.com/earthly/earthly/blob/main/docs/guides/best-practices.md#2025-04-21_snippet_29

LANGUAGE: Dockerfile
CODE:
```
# Bad
all:
    BUILD +dep
    BUILD +run-locally
dep:
    FROM alpine:3.18
    WORKDIR /work
    RUN echo "Hello World" > ./my-artifact.txt
    SAVE ARTIFACT ./my-artifact.txt AS LOCAL ./build/my-artifact.txt
run-locally:
    LOCALLY
    RUN echo ./build/my-artifact.txt
```
